subject: Music
title: Jazz Education
description: A quick win: understand Jazz Education.

hook.text: Jazz used to be learned on bandstands. Now it's taught in universities worldwide.

buildup.text: Berklee, Juilliard, and hundreds of programs train thousands of jazz musicians each year.

discovery.text: Academic jazz training produces technically brilliant players with deep theoretical knowledge.

twist.text: Critics argue schools produce polished players who lack the raw edge of street-trained legends.

climax.text: The best modern players combine formal training with the hunger of self-taught innovators.

punchline.text: The classroom teaches the notes. The bandstand teaches the music.

quiz.question: What criticism do some make of academic jazz training?
options: It may produce polished players who lack raw edge
Students never learn to read music
